Class Board

java.lang.Object
board.Board
public class Board extends Object
Represents an 8x8 chess board with pieces. Manages board state, piece movement, special moves (castling, en passant), and check/checkmate detection. The board uses array indices where row 0 = rank 8 (black's back rank) and row 7 = rank 1 (white's back rank).
Version:
1.0
Author:
Jacob Sierra and Robert Zamora

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Board()
    Constructs a new chess board and initializes it with pieces in their standard starting positions.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Constructs a new chess board and initializes it with pieces in their standard starting positions.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the board with pieces in standard chess starting positions. Sets up white pieces on ranks 1-2 (rows 6-7) and black pieces on ranks 7-8 (rows 0-1).

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece(Position position)
      Retrieves the piece at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      position - the board position to check
      Returns:
      the Piece at the position, or null if the square is empty

    • movePiece

      public void movePiece(Position from, Position to)
      Moves a piece from one position to another. Handles special moves including: - En passant capture - Castling (moving both king and rook) - Two-square pawn moves (sets en passant target) Updates the piece's internal position and the hasMoved flag.
      Parameters:
      from - the starting position
      to - the destination position

    • display

      public void display()
      Displays the current board state to the console using ASCII representation. Shows pieces with notation (e.g., "wp" for white pawn, "bK" for black king). Empty squares are shown as "##" (dark squares) or " " (light squares).

    • getGrid

      public Piece[][] getGrid()
      Gets the internal grid representation of the board.
      Returns:
      2D array of Pieces representing the board state

    • getEnPassantTarget

      public Position getEnPassantTarget()
      Gets the current en passant target square, if any.
      Returns:
      the Position where en passant capture is possible, or null if none

    • setPiece

      public void setPiece(Position position, Piece piece)
      Places a piece at the specified position on the board. Used primarily for pawn promotion.
      Parameters:
      position - the board position
      piece - the Piece to place, or null to clear the square

    • findKing

      public Position findKing(String color)
      Searches the board to find the position of the king of the specified color.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the king to find ("white" or "black")
      Returns:
      the Position of the king, or null if not found

    • isPositionUnderAttack

      public boolean isPositionUnderAttack(Position position, String byColor)
      Determines if a specific position is under attack by pieces of the specified color.
      Parameters:
      position - the board position to check
      byColor - the color of the attacking pieces to check
      Returns:
      true if the position is under attack, false otherwise

    • isInCheck

      public boolean isInCheck(String color)
      Checks if the king of the specified color is currently in check.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the king to check
      Returns:
      true if the king is in check, false otherwise

    • wouldMoveLeaveKingInCheck

      public boolean wouldMoveLeaveKingInCheck(Position from, Position to, String color)
      Simulates a move to determine if it would leave the player's king in check. This is used to validate legal moves and prevent illegal moves that would expose the king to attack.
      Parameters:
      from - the starting position of the piece
      to - the destination position
      color - the color of the player making the move
      Returns:
      true if the move would leave the king in check, false otherwise

    • hasAnyLegalMoves

      public boolean hasAnyLegalMoves(String color)
      Checks if a player has any legal moves remaining. Used to detect checkmate (no legal moves while in check) and stalemate (no legal moves while not in check).
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the player to check
      Returns:
      true if the player has at least one legal move, false otherwise
